title: Sent folder corruption
content:
My wife has been using Thunderbird for her email since 2010. It has largely worked well for her. Until a few days ago. She uses POP and we have our own domain for email. She wanted to make it easier to find sent messages (currently close to 70,000 messages) so she created a "Sent pre-2024" and started dragging and dropping some of the messages from the "Sent" folder into the "Sent pre-2024" folder. It has not gone well.

Thunderbird now routinely says it cannot send or save newly written and sent messages to the Sent folder. She has to close Thunderbird and open it again, and then the messages are sent, usually but not always saved in the Sent message folder.

In addition, there are now several additional system-created Sent message folders (Sent-1, Sent-2, etc. up to Sent-15 and Sent.msf-1.compact.backup with different numbers and one that is named sent.msf.compact-backup) that cannot be deleted, or if they are deleted they create themselves again. Some of these folders have messages in them and some do not. All of these folders are listed as Local Folders.

At some point she put all of the messages back in the Sent messges folder.

We have tried deleting all of the .msf files. We have deleted the global-messages-db.sqlite file and let Thunderbird rebuild the indexes.

How do we get rid of the extra (Sent-1, Sent-2, etc.) folders and, more importantly, return Thunderbird so when she presses the "Send" button, the messages are sent then and stored in the Sent message folder?

Any help is GREATLY appreciated. Thank you.
creator: mark572

title: security exception thunderbird and more
content: I have 2 problems and I NEED HELP ! We have 5 computers using thunderbird 2 at home 2 at work and 2 laptop, the laptop has Kasperski as the antivirus and the other 4 has Norton 360. Recently (a few months ago) all 4 computers with thunderbird started asking confirm a security exception every morning, its very frustrating and seems nothing we do can fix it on all 4, my email service providor CONETIX helped me with 2 systems which seems to have fixed those but the other 2 at home nothing seems to work ! All are Windowes 10, the older computer systems are at home. Some online forums suggest that the anti-virus is most likely the problem, I am NOT computer savy so anything complicated gets beyound my capability, can some one help with an easy to understand FIX for this ? The 2nd set of problems only started last week or so only on one of my work systems, I have no idea what caused it none, one morning I statred up as normal and all in incoming email has pictures of a power supply in the main body and any attachments the same, I deleted those and resent them back to myself off the laptop, they worked fine doing that, this has happened twice...................3rd time today I opened an email from April from my realestate and it has a picture of a dirty floor and no message and the attachement has the same picture, I dont even know where that picture came from ! Last week I deleted Thunderbird and a folder I found on Program Files and then redown loaded Thunderbird again, clearly theres some sort of screw up in the progam or something, every time I start up Thunderbird in the morning now it opwns up on an email on the inbox from more than a year ago, OK its easy just to scroll / pull down the slide thing to todays date and work in from there.................but if I exit email it starts at the old date all over again when I open it. PLEASE HELP ! I dont know to work your troubleshooter .................

title: Wrong Attribution for Interac Notification
content: When I send an Interac e-transfer, my bank sends me two email notifications. The first is that I have sent an Interac e-transfer, and the second tells me that the recipient has accepted it. Both of these notifications used to say that the sender was my bank, and continue to do that on my ISP's email portal. On Thuderbird, however, the first emails indicate that they are from my bank, and the second ones show that they are coming from my friend "John Smith" (who happens to be someone who sends me occasional Interac e-transfers). This has happened about 5 times now, and has done so over the last two months. This makes me very nervous! If Thunderbird is inserting someone else's name as the sender, and not my bank, is John Smith notified about anything? I do not want my private banking actions communicated to anyone other than me and/or my bank. And why does my ISP's email portal show the sender correctly, and Thunderbird makes up the fact that it is from John Smith? Any help with this would be greatly appreciated. I searched this forum for "Interac" and didn't find anything similar.
creator: alan410

title: Multiple copies of messages arriving in  inbox
content: For many months now I have had a problem with one of my mailboxes. When I open that mailbox, I will get additional copies of emails that have already been downloaded in the previous several days. When I opened this mailbox this morning, new emails were very slow to load. When eventually the new emails started to arrive, again there were copies of previously received emails coming in also. As of now, I have single copies of emails that are dated today (02 Sept), 01 Sept, 31 Aug, 30 Aug, 29 Aug, and some from 28 Aug. However, also on 28 Aug, I have 5 copies of numerous emails. Emails dated 27 Aug, I also have 5 copies. Emails dated Aug 26, I have 3 copies. Emails dated 25 Aug, I have 3 copies. This pattern of 3 copies of emails continues back to Aug 17. For Aug 16 and Aug 15, I have only single copies of emails. On Aug 14, I have two copies of each email. I have tried turning off my anti virus software (TotalAV) and I have tried excluding the Thunderbird\Profiles folder. I still have the same problem. The other mailbox that I have, does not have the same multiple copies problem. It occurs to me that there is one difference between these two mailboxes. The one that does not have the problem, opens automatically because I have saved the login password. The mailbox that has the problem, I have not saved the password and need to enter the password each time. Could this difference in logging in be causing the problem? Anyway, I hope someone can help me resolve this problem. Please reply to: nikkay@internode.on.net

title: sincronizzazione non corretta di thunderbird con server synology
content:
Salve, da molti anni utilizzo thunderbird (ver. 128.1.1esr -64 bit) con windows 11 pro. In particolare, l'ho sempre utilizzato sia per scaricare la posta e sia per gli appuntamenti del calendario tramite un server synology. La modalità di ricezione della posta è IMAP, con la porta 993, con sicurezza SSL/TLS e password normale, (la configurazione iniziale avviene sempre in modalità automatizzata).

Recentemente (da circa 1 mese), però, thunderbird quando esegue la sincronizzazione: - rileva cartelle cancellate (vuote) nella cartella "Archive"; - sincronizza soltanto una parte delle cartelle utilizzate e per alcune di esse non riesce a caricare le email contenute; - ha difficoltà a creare nuove cartelle in quanto non si sincronizzano con il server synology.

Il calendario, invece, funziona perfettamente.

Preciso che ho testato la ricezione con altre applicazioni (mailbird, emclient, ed altri) e tutto funziona perfettamente senza riscontrare assolutamente i predetti problemi.

Ho sempre utilizzato Thunderbird e sarei contento se riuscissi a riprendere la normale fuinzionalità che ormai mi segue da diversi anni.

PS ho provato a disinstallare completamente Thunderbird e reinstallarlo ( anche su altri pc) ma il problema persiste.

Potete aitutarmi? Grazie anticipate

title: BCC mail list
content:
Hi, I've been using Thunderbird since it's inception in 2003 and so far have been delighted with all the innovations and changes which have occurred since that time. However, I have only recently come across a very unusual ocurrence:

MY PC specs: Device name DESKTOP-EK6DE3O Processor AMD A8-9600 RADEON R7, 10 COMPUTE CORES 4C+6G 3.10 GHz Installed RAM 16.0 GB (15.0 GB usable) Device ID 1BEB8A9E-543E-458C-A36D-83606B41F757 Product ID 00326-00828-84284-AAOEM System type 64-bit operating system, x64-based processor

Mozilla Thunderbird version: Version 128.1.1esr Build ID 20240820161839 Distribution ID Update Folder C:\ProgramData\Mozilla-1de4eec8-1241-4177-a864-e594e8d1fb38\updates\D78BF5DD33499EC2 .

So, my problem is that I have a 50 odd list of email addresses which I send BCC. This list is called "Playlist" (nicknamed "BCC mail out") and in the past I have been able to click on that name, in the BCC field and then send after writing in body of email. Very recently, last week in fact, when I click on that BCC list "Playlist" and then try to send, the following message appears: "BCC Mail out < > is not a valid email address because it is not of the form user@host. You must correct it before sending the email". I adopted this method years ago and found it really fast and very convenient, yet now I have to go into address book; highlight all the addresses in "playlist"; change from To to BCC, then add To (and aslo CC)(for different addresses). Sending this way still works, but seems a very round-about way of doing it! What has happened in this version of Thunderbird compared to previous versions? Can it be resolved, please? Any chance of making it 'backwards' compatible? You all do a great job. Regards Dave
creator: davidbarker1942

title: Thunderbird feels very slow.
content:
Hello,

I would very much like Thunderbird to be my main email program on my MacBook Pro. However, Thunderbird feels very slow compared to Apple Mail or MailMate.

Installed software:

  • Thunderbird 128.1.1esr (64-bit)
  • macOS Sonoma 14.6.1 (23G93)

Some examples of slow:

  • when using keyboard `down` key to go over each message in a folder, displaying the selected email can't keep up with me going over the list.
  • when using the mouse, sometimes selecting an email message (left-click and hold) is processed fractions of a second later. I have to wait for the visual rendering of the selected image before moving my mouse to drop the message somewhere else.

Is there a development track to improve the speed of Thunderbird (on macOS)?

Ringo

title: Anti Virus feature disabled, but seems to not be fully disabled
content:
I am using Bitdefender Internet Security. I do NOT want it checking my emails. I have Anti-Spam for email in that software disabled.

I also have the Thunderbird Anti Virus feature to "make it easy for anti-virus software to analyse incoming mail messages for viruses before they are stored locally" disabled.

Yet, I still see a somewhat greyed out Bitdefender feature top right in Thunderbird ever since I updated Thunderbird several iterations to 128.1.0esr (64-bit), and the REAL PROBLEM is that now it takes a long time for my email to get downloaded from the mail servers.

So I suspect that Bitdefender is still able to check that email thus delaying it in the download process, and having the feature in Thunderbird for Anti Virus disabled is simply stopping Bitdefender from tagging emails as spam and moving them into the junk folder (which is also undesirable to me).

If I have that Anti Virus feature in Thunderbird disabled, I would expect that it should make it impossible for Bitdefender to even place a button, greyed out or not, in Thunderbird, or have any other access to it for any reason whatsoever.

I really hope there's a solution I'm somehow missing, or that Mozilla can address this, as it's a real pain waiting an extra few minutes every time I download my email!

title: Thunderbird unresponsive receiving new mails since 128.0.1
content:
Hi community, I have browsed a bit in the web but haven't found a solution.

I'm a long-term Thunderbird user having this as my to-go-mail-client on every computer since almost 20 years and have always been happy with it. However since the last major update to 128.0.1 my Thunderbird has become very unresponsive whenever I start it or I receive an email.

I have 3 mail accounts in my Thunderbird set up. Two accounts are using POP, these seem to work as expected. The third account is a (company)-Google account that syncs mails via IMAP. Whenever I receive an email with this Google-account I see the blue loading bar at the bottom-right of the UI and this takes a while to load (even when receiving only one email), as long as this loads my Thunderbird is "Not responding". After approximately one minute I can read my new email and work as always (until a new mail comes in and it becomes unresponsive again). Needless to say that this is not very great for working productive and I hope to find a solution, so I don't have to get used to a new mail client.

Currently I'm on 128.1.1 on Windows 11, as said this issue started with the update to 128.0.1 some weeks ago.

Happy to provide more details or test some steps if someone has a helpful idea how to improve things
creator: christophl

title: "Quick filter" option no longer displays icons for filtering by Unread, Starred, etc, instead hiding behind a mis-aligned dropdown menu
content:
In a former version of Thunderbird, selecting the "Quick Filter" button would cause an extra bar below the search filter to appear with various different icons you could press to filter messages by whether they had an attachment, whether they were starred, etc.

Now, it seems the default is instead to hide all of these options a bit inconveniently in a small "settings"-like button dropdown, with only words rather than helpful icons. To boot, this button is strangely aligned to the topleft, giving it very irregular padding that makes it feel a bit janky.

How can I get back the original behavior? It felt far more intuitive and required much less precise clicking.

title: Problemen met verzenden mails
content:
Ik gebruik al jaren Thunderbird (windows, POP3) en heb nooit problemen gehad. Ik krijg sinds enige tijd bij het verzenden van een bericht echter steeds de melding "Er is onvoldoende schijfruimte om nieuwe berichten te downloaden. Verwijder oude e-mail, maak de prullenbak leeg, comprimeer e-mailmappen en probeer het opnieuw."

Heb inmiddels van alles gedaan - alle oude mails verwijderd, account verwijderd en nieuwe aangemaakt, Thunderbird opnieuw geïnstalleerd, alle mappen gecomprimeerd, alle mappen geprobeerd te herstellen, buffers leeg gemaakt, gecheckt of ik voldoende ruimte op server en eigen schijf heb, alle msf-bestanden verwijderd, ... niets helpt.

Ik weet het echt niet meer - wat zie ik over het hoofd?
creator: kraakman-han

title: Thunderbird Split Screen
content: I had to reinstall Thunderbird after a crash. Before, my inbox was split in two. The top half was the messages and the bottom half a preview of the selected message. Now I just have one long list of emails. Please can you advise how to go back to the split screen view. Many thanks.
creator: bw0803

title: Google contacts only syncing one way
content: V128 on Win 10 and 11. I create a contact on Thunderbird, and it syncs with Google Contacts. But if I create or delete a Google Contact, it does not sync back to Thunderbird Address Book.

title: Quick Filter issue
content:
When entering a person's name in Quick Filter the messages are filtered fine. But when I click on any of the messages below, the email messages changes to some other message and I am unable to find the original message that was listed from the filter.

Please help.

title: Email folders have disappeared
content: I had problems connecting with Thunderbird for 24 hours (I connect via an imap server from my Sky account). When this was rectified, email folders which I had created had disappeared. These contain historical emails which I can ill-afford to lose. How do I restore these?
creator: carahr

title: new group address file
content: i have a half dozen personal group address books in thunderbird but cannot find out how to enter a new one. i spent a lot of time with my menu (tools, files, etc.) and could find nothing related to setting up a new group file. Please help...

title: Ghost ID
content: I've installed Thunderbird 128.1.1 but it stalls on startup looking for a pw for a gmail I no longer have access to. This account was deleted 6 months ago. Today, I found one item in the account list under Local Files which I deleted. The problem persists.

title: My email password
content:
I have a couple of networked desktops running Ubuntu Linux. Attempting an ( unsuccessful ) software upgrade , wiped out my Thunderbird email connection on the affected machine. I still have a functioning version on the other. 

       To reinstate email on my non-functional Thunderbird, I need my email password.        Where in my functional version might I find it?
